intro: Englerodendron triplisomere, commonly known as the three-lobed englerodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, each leaflet being ovate with serrated edges. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and numerous stamens. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
